content.prompt: Which of the following best describes how nineteenth-century European industrialization affected European womenâ€™s lives?

choices.label: By the end of the century, new social welfare legislation made it possible for most women to earn university degrees.
Married women found it increasingly difficult to balance wage work and family responsibilities.
By the end of the century, women gained the right to vote in most European countries.
Women came to dominate the agricultural workforce as men moved to cities to take industrial jobs.

topic.text: 5.10: Continuity and Change in the Industrial Age

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
